isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ANTILOCK BRAKE INTERFACE

svcproc.title: ANTILOCK BRAKE INTERFACE
svcproc.para: On vehicles with both the Bendix Antilock Brake System (ABS) and the Allison WT Transmission, circuit 154/94J directly links the WT ECU with the ABS ECU.

With the vehicle in a normal operating mode, a 12V signal will be sent from the WT ECU to the ABS ECU. A ground switch located in the ABS ECM will remain OPEN during normal vehicle operation (or with key OFF). When the ABS ECU ground switch is OPEN, the WT ECU will permit the transmission lockup clutch (or transmission retarder) to be engaged in a normal manner.

If the ABS brake system senses an impending wheel lockup condition and modulates the air brake system (to prevent wheel lockup), the 12V signal from the WT ECU will be turned ON when the ground switch (located in the ABS ECM) closes. With the circuit closed between the ABS and the WT electronic control units, the transmission lockup clutch (and transmission retarder if equipped) will be disengaged, and the transmission will "hydraulically" link to the drive wheels rather than mechanically.
